request_pathways.name: Authorization for Release of Medical Information (English)
Mail to HIM – Release of Information Department, 25 North Winfield Road, Winfield, IL 60190

forms.document_type: Inbound records request form (authorization to disclose TO NMHC)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients use a generic system-wide authorization form with a 'Personal Use' purpose checkbox, listing themselves as the recipient.

red_flags: No reference to HIPAA Right of Access (§ 164.524) — patient self-access is not distinguished from third-party authorization
Fee language cites Illinois copying statute (735 ILCS 5/8-2006) without clarifying HIPAA's lower cost-based fee limit for patient access requests
bright_spots: MyNM patient portal offered as a delivery method for requested records
Spanish-language form with equivalent fillable-field functionality (82 fields)
Email submission accepted (releaseofinformation@nm.org) — uncommon among healthcare organizations
Record-type categories include parenthetical explanations of what each includes
Memorable toll-free number (877.9RECORD) with TTY: 711 accessibility

findability.rationale: Level 5: Forms are prominently available — a basic web search immediately returns direct download links to the PDFs on nm.org's CDN with no navigation, login, or CAPTCHA required.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: The form has 79 fillable fields enabling full digital completion, and email/fax submission is available; however, the workflow requires filling the PDF separately and then emailing or faxing it rather than a single integrated submission.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized 2-page form with logical flow, clear section headers, and helpful parenthetical explanations of record types; minor issues include dense legal language in the disclosure section.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the process by selecting 'Personal Use' and listing themselves as recipient, but the form was designed for third-party release — the patient must navigate sections intended for attorneys/insurers and figure out which parts apply to self-access.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: The form states a 30-day response time, includes right to revoke and no-care-denial clauses, and references 42 CFR Part 2; minor ambiguity in fee language citing Illinois statute without distinguishing HIPAA's lower patient-access fee limit.

overall.summary: Northwestern Medicine provides technically excellent, easy-to-find forms with strong digital features and Spanish-language support, but channels patient self-access through a generic third-party authorization form without acknowledging distinct patient access rights under HIPAA.
